required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Tolerability of CKD-510 in Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: First-in-Human, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Food Effects of CKD-510 in Single Ascending Dose and Multiple Ascending Dose in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a first-in-human study of CKD-510 in single-ascending dose and multiple-ascending dose in healthy subjects. This trial is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics of food effects of CKD-510.

primary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Number of subjects with adverse events (AEs)
primary_outcome.description: The relationship of each adverse event to the investigational product was assessed by the investigator.

primary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Safety as assessed by vital signs
primary_outcome.description: Symptoms of vital signs will be assessed.

primary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Safety as assessed by abbreviated physical examination parameters
primary_outcome.description: Physical exmaination will include evaluation of main body systems/regions

primary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Safety as assessed by electrocardiogram (ECG) parameters
primary_outcome.description: 12-lead ECGs will be obtained during the study using an ECG machine

primary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Safety as assessed by biological analysis
primary_outcome.description: Biological test will be obtained with assessments including hematology, biochemistry, urinalysis.

primary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Composite of pharmacokinetics (PK) assessments of CKD-510
primary_outcome.description: PK parameters include plasma concentrations of CKD-510, maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax), time to Cmax (tmax), area under the plasma concentration-time curve (AUC) to last measurable concentration [AUC(0-t)], AUC through 24 hours [AUC(0-24)] and AUC per dosing interval [AUC(0-tau)], apparent terminal phase half-life following the last dose (t1/2) in fast or fed conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Composite of pharmacodynamics (PD) assessments of CKD-510
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in acetylation of alpha-tubulin and histone as pharmacodynamics assessments after an administration of CKD-510 in fast or fed conditions

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Maximum plasma concentration of CKD-510
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Time of maximum plasma concentration of CKD-510
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Changes from baseline in plasma concentrations CKD-510 in time after dosing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time 0 extrapolated to the last quantifiable concentration at time t (AUC0-t)

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Time of plasma elimination half-life of CKD-510
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Volume of distribution of CKD-510
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution during the terminal elimination phase (Vd/F)

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Total plasma clearance of CKD-510
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part A, Part C] Pharmacodynamics assessments of CKD-510
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 days post dose (SAD) or 17 days post dose (MAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in acetylation of alpha-tubulin and histone

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Number of subjects with adverse events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship of each adverse event to the investigational product was assessed by the investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Safety as assessed by vital signs
secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms of vital signs will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Safety as assessed by abbreviated physical examination parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Physical exmaination will include evaluation of main body systems/regions

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Safety as assessed by electrocardiogram (ECG) parameters
secondary_outcome.description: 12-lead ECGs will be obtained during the study using an ECG machine

secondary_outcome.measure: [Part B] Safety as assessed by biological analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Biological test will be obtained with assessments including hematology, biochemistry, urinalysis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male subject
- Non-smoker subject or light smoker
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18 and 30 kg/m2 inclusive at screening
- Laboratory parameters within the normal range of the laboratory.
- Male volunteers must be either vasectomized or agree to use a condom during the course of the study and until 3 months (90 days) after the participant's last visit
- Signing a written informed consent prior to selection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any history or presence of cardiovascular, pulmonary, gastro-intestinal, hepatic, renal, metabolic, hematological, neurologic, psychiatric, systemic or infectious disease
- Blood donation within 2 months before administration
- General anesthesia within 3 months before administration
- Presence or history of drug hypersensitivity, or allergic disease
- Any drug intake (except paracetamol or contraception) during the 28 days prior to the first administration
- History or presence of alcohol or drug abuse
- Subject who, in the judgment of the Investigator, is likely to be non-compliant or uncooperative during the study, or unable to cooperate because of a language problem, poor mental development
- Use of an investigational drug within 3 months (or 90 days) prior to Day1
